fields.value: BUILDING BIOCARBON AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT IN WEST AFRICA (BIODEV), M&E

dsDescriptionValue.value: The overarching goals of this assessment of BIODEV interventions are to: (1) understand differences across pilot and comparison sites in key selected outcomes that relate to improved governance and institutional fostering, germplasm systems and adoption of agroforestry innovations, marketing of agroforestry products; (2) determine the average short term effects on some selected outcomes (3) draw from our study findings policy-relevant recommendations on how BIODEV interventions might sustainably be supported or better refined to meet its goals more effectively.

files.description:
This dataset is a survey of 509 households in eight villages in order to evaluate the effects of BIODEV interventions on household incomes, local governance and institutions, germplasm systems and improved markets for agroforestry products among other outcomes.
 The study focused on eight villages in the Ziro Province surrounding the forest reserve of Cassou. The survey sample comprises project beneficiaries in the 4 intervention villages (Cassou, Kou, Dao, Vrassan) and non-beneficiaries in 4 other villages selected as controls (Tiao, Bougnounou, Pro and Mao Nassira) in the same province.
files.label: Finalsurveycomplet_cleanfinal.dta
